mods.abstract: Adams discusses his childhood on Bobs Lane in Golden Meadow, La., and what children did for recreation, which included hunting and sports. He spent time with his father in the garden, hunting, and at church. He was raised Catholic and his father was particularly devout. Adams recalls the shrimp packing plants in Golden Meadow and discusses the local fishing culture, including recent developments. He discusses, throughout the interview, how Golden Meadow has changed, specifically the sense of community, commerce and development. He talks about his first job at the ice plant, and about the Golden Meadow Police Department, where he worked from 1976 to 2005. Adams recalls his grandparents and his family's Cajun heritage.
mods.note: This collection includes materials accessioned as Mss. 4700.2351. A digital version of the index (pdf) exists for duplication purposes. A digital version of the audio recording (mp3) exists for duplication purposes and public access in the Special Collections Reading Room. Interview conducted by Kai Duffy.

Reynold "Ray" Adams, Harold's brother, was born in Golden Meadow, La., around 1944 to Andrew Adams and Letucia Johnfroe Adams. He grew up on Bobs Lane, which was home to the Adams and the Collins extended families. Adams's father was a refrigeration engineer at an ice plant; Adams also worked there for 13 years after high school. In 1976 he became a Golden Meadow deputy police officer, and was eventually promoted to chief of police, a position from which he retired. Adams is a practicing Catholic. He is married to Judy Adams and has children and four grandchildren.
